thread.title: Woods leads No. 3 Jefferson over Morgan
thread.title_full: Woods leads No. 3 Jefferson over Morgan

author: Staff
title: Woods leads No. 3 Jefferson over Morgan
text:
Woods leads No. 3 Jefferson over Morgan From Staff Reports – updated Saturday, October 10, 2015 - 12:01am 
JEFFERSON | Colby Wood rushed 23 times for 153 yards and two touchdowns as Jefferson – ranked No. 3 in Class AAA – defeated Morgan County 17-0 in Region 8-AAA play. 
Wood, who had 72 yards at halftime, scored on a 1-yard run with 8:38 left in the first quarter and on a 2-yard rush with 10:50 remaining before halftime. 
Hayden Kilgore added a 34-yard field goal with 6:02 left in the second quarter. 
The Dragons (7-0, 3-0) will play at 7:30 p.m. Friday at East Jackson. Morgan County (3-3, 1-1), which has not been shut out since October 2013, will host Oconee County at 7:30 p.m. Friday. 
MADISON COUNTY 59, CHESTATEE 29: At Gainesville, the Red Raiders won their first game of the season in fine style, scoring 31 first-half points en route to a Region 8-AAAA rout. 
Quarterback David Metts rushed for three touchdowns and threw for two more. J.J. Burton added two rushing touchdowns and a receiving score, and Austin Hill also had a receiving touchdown. 
Madison County’s 59 points represents its biggest scoring night since Oct. 18, 2002, when the Red Raiders defeated Northview 58-0. 
The Red Raiders (1-5, 1-2) will host North Hall at 7:30 p.m. Friday. Chestatee (0-6, 0-3) will play at 7:30 p.m. Friday at Stephens County. 
ATHENS CHRISTIAN 35, TOWNS COUNTY 7: At Hiawassee, Joseph Russell ran for three touchdowns as the Eagles defeated Towns County in Region 8-A. 
Russell scored on runs of 3 and 25 yards in the first quarter and Cody Lee connected with Richard Jibunor on a 34-yard touchdown, also in the first quarter. 
Rusell scored again on a 2-yard run in the fourth quarter and Archie Killian scored on a 2-yard run in the third quarter. 
Athens Christian (3-4, 2-3) will host George Walton at 7:30 p.m. Friday. Towns County (1-6, 1-4) will play at 7:30 p.m. Friday at Prince Avenue Christian. 
NORTH OCONEE 33, MONROE AREA 6: At Monroe, the Titans evened their record 3-3 overall and improved to 2-1 in Region 8-AAAA with a dominating victory over the Purple Hurricanes. 
After a North Oconee safety, Khyrie Moore ran the free kick back 75 yards to put the Titans up 9-0. Kyriece Wrice scored on a 10-yard run and Sam Middlebrooks hit Moore on a 45-yard scoring strike to make it 23-0. 
Simon Clarke added a 25-yard field goal and Turner Daniel completed the scoring with a 33-yard rush. 
Wrice rushed 10 times for 49 yards and Middlebrooks completed 9 of 15 passes for 137 yards. The Titans had impressive offensive balance, rushing for 137 yards and passing for 137 yards. 
On defense, Chandler Vismor, Kyle Poole and Grant Fordham all recorded interceptions. 
North Oconee will host White County at 7:30 p.m. Friday. Monroe Area (2-4, 1-2) will play at 7:30 p.m. at Buford. 
FLOWERY BRANCH 28, CLARKE CENTRAL 21: At Clarke Central, despite being outscored 14-12 in the second half, the Falcons earned the Region 8- victory. 
JaQua Daniels scored on runs of 4 and 70 yards and Jack Mangel hit Reggie Smothers on a 62-yard touchdown pass for Clarke Central. 
The Gladiators (2-4, 2-3) will host Gainesville at 7:30 p.m. Friday. Flowery Branch (4-3, 3-2) will host Apalachee at 7:30 p.m. Friday. 
LOGANVILLE 23, CEDAR SHOALS 7: At Loganville, the Red Devils improved to 6-1 overall and 5-1 in Region 8- with a decisive victory over the Jaguars. 
Stavion Stevenson scored Cedar Shoals’ only touchdown in the fourth quarter. 
The Jaguars (1-5, 1-4) will host Winder-Barrow at 7:30 p.m. Friday. Loganville will play at 7:30 p.m. Friday at Salem. 
ELBERT COUNTY 20, JACKSON COUNTY 14: At Elberton, Jace Latty scored on a 1-yard sneak to put the Panthers up 7-6 and Latty tossed a 13-yard touchdown pass to Chase Wester, but the Blue Devils – ranked No. 7 in Class AAA – escaped the Granite Bowl with a victory. 
Jackson County (3-4, 0-3) will host Hart County at 730 p.m. Friday. Elbert County (6-1, 2-1) will host Morgan County at 7:30 p.m. on Friday, Oct. 23. 
RABUN COUNTY 54, OGLETHORPE COUNTY 12: At Lexington, Connor Cinereski scored on a 12-yard run and Devin Bryant added another scoring run, but the Patriots were soundly defeated by Rabun County, ranked No. 8 in Class AA. 
Oglethorpe County (0-7, 0-2 in Region 8-AA) will play at 7:30 p.m. Friday at Riverside Military Academy. Rabun County (6-1, 3-0) will host Union County – ranked No. 7 in Class AA -- at 7:30 p.m. Friday. 
HART COUNTY 62, EAST JACKSON 0: At Hartwell, the Bulldogs overwhelmed the Eagles in Region 8-AAA play. 
East Jackson (1-6, 0-3) will host Jefferson at 7:30 p.m. Friday. Hart County (4-2, 1-1) will play at 7:30 p.m. Friday at Jackson County. 
BRIARWOOD ACADEMY 47, MONSIGNOR DONOVAN 14: At Warrenton, Tae Clay and Edwin Summerhour scored on fourth-quarter touchdown passes from Simon Saupe as the Rams avoided 
The Rams (0-7) will host Brentwood at 7:30 p.m. Friday.
